column2: My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName], [From.Reincarnation.GetTitledFirstName] reborn, is acting more like [From.GetPossPronoun] previous incarnation every day! [From.GetFirstName] is definitely expressing another of [From.Reincarnation.GetFirstName]'s personality traits...
column3: My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName], [From.Reincarnation.GetTitledFirstName] reborn, is acting more like [From.GetPossPronoun] previous incarnation every day! [From.GetFirstName] is definitely expressing another of [From.Reincarnation.GetFirstName]'s personality traits...

column2: With a realm to rival that of Charlemagne, I could be recognized as his true successor and, invoking Translatio Imperii, have [Root.RelHead.GetBestName] crown me Emperor of a new Roman Empire in the west!
column3: With a realm to rival that of Charlemagne, I could be recognized as his true successor and, invoking Translatio Imperii, have [Root.RelHead.GetBestName] crown me Emperor of a new Roman Empire in the west!

column2: Buddhism was founded by the Buddha, Siddhartha Gautama, in Northeast India in the 5th century BC. The religion flourished in India for more than 1500 years, building huge libraries and monastery complexes, until Muslim invasions and the growing power of the Brahmin caste drove Buddhism out of the subcontinent. In the game, Buddhists get a significant bonus to Learning, meaning that they will research technologies faster.
column3:
Buddhism was founded by the Buddha, Siddhartha Gautama, in Northeast India in the 5th century BC. The religion flourished in India for more than 1500 years, building huge libraries and monastery complexes, until Muslim invasions and the growing power of the Brahmin caste drove Buddhism out of the subcontinent. In the game, Buddhists get a significant bonus to Learning, meaning that they will research technologies faster. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is no religious head
§Y*§! Caste Traits do not matter
§Y*§! Buddhists get a hefty Learning bonus
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all Indian religions
§Y*§! Can declare limited Holy Wars against non-Indian religions
§Y*§! Hard to convert Jain and Hindu counties
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir

column2: Jainism is a religion of incredible antiquity, stemming from the ascetic Sramana tradition of India, in opposition to the priestly Brahmins and the caste system. The guiding principle of Jainism is Ahimsa - non-violence - which is more radically interpreted than in any other religion. In the game, Jains have a hard time waging offensive wars, but their remarkable tolerance means Jain rulers are well liked by all.
column3:
Jainism is a religion of incredible antiquity, stemming from the ascetic Sramana tradition of India, in opposition to the priestly Brahmins and the caste system. The guiding principle of Jainism is Ahimsa - non-violence - which is more radically interpreted than in any other religion. In the game, Jains have a hard time waging offensive wars, but their remarkable tolerance means Jain rulers are well liked by all. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is no religious head
§Y*§! Caste Traits do not matter
§Y*§! Cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all Indian religions
§Y*§! Much lower chance of provincial revolts
§Y*§! Large bonuses to all vassal opinions
§Y*§! Rulers can hold larger Demesnes
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir

column2: A brilliant Turkish mercenary and former slave warrior by the name of Sabuktigin has distinguished himself many times, leading his company of horsemen in battle and raids. My commanders think I should give him a more prominent position.

column3: A brilliant Turkish mercenary and former slave warrior by the name of Sabuktigin has distinguished himself many times, leading his company of horsemen in battle and raids. My commanders think I should give him a more prominent position.

column2: A former Turkish mercenary and slave soldier is on the rise in the land of the Afghans. This Sabuktigin, a zealous man who loathes infidels, seems intent on creating an empire to rival that of the Caliphs of old, as he has just finished crushing [FromFrom.GetTitledName] in a brutal war. Tens of thousands of fierce tribesmen have gathered under his banner!

column2: The four traditions of Hinduism are Shaivism, Vaishnavism, Shaktism and Smartism. You have decided to choose a new way, but which one shall it be?
The three great branches of Buddhism are Mahayana, Vajrayana and Theravada. You have decided to look for a new philosophy, but which one shall it be?
column3: The four traditions of Hinduism are Shaivism, Vaishnavism, Shaktism and Smartism. You have decided to choose a new way, but which one shall it be?

column2: The moral authority of a religion affects the conversion chances of characters and counties and the susceptibility to heresies. A low authority value can prevent the chief pontiff from performing special actions like excommunication. It may also cause instability with various negative events in your realm as the religious institutions lose their grip on the populace.
column3: The three great branches of Buddhism are Mahayana, Vajrayana and Theravada. You have decided to look for a new philosophy, but which one shall it be?

The moral authority of a religion affects the conversion chances of characters and provinces and the susceptibility to heresies. A low authority value can prevent the chief pontiff from performing special actions like excommunication. It may also cause instability with various negative events in your realm as the religious institutions lose their grip on the populace.

column2: Hire §Y$TITLE$§W for §Y$COST$§W $PIETYNAME$. (They will arrive in or nearby §Y$CAPITAL$§W.)
